website_summaries.verdict: This shoe stretcher is very well made, durable, and designed specifically for boots – but it won't work for all styles or sizes.
pros: Stretcher works for most men's and women's boots
cons: Doesn't fit small or narrow boots
Not recommended for cowboy boots – best suited for work and hiking styles

customer_reviews.title: Works very well....
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Got the yellow/black plastic ones and didn't notice that they were too small for my size 23 Lowa Baffin Pro 2 boots. This item worked very well on stretching out those problem areas on my left foot which is just a tad bigger than my right. Would like to see more than 3 metal spot stretchers. Had to stretch meuktille days as there is only 1 stretcher and only 3 metal spot things. But even after all that, I have to give it 5 stars as it works. Very well. Use leather stretcher spray or do a 50/50 rubbing alcohol/water in a spray bottle. Saved my $360 boots. Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stryker

customer_reviews.title: Broken after once use.
customer_reviews.text: i used this product, along with a stretching spray, for a pair of frye combat boots. it worked well on the first boot, but it broke while stretching my second boot. the device would not unwiden so it was wedged inside my shoe, while i spent 10 minutes struggling to remove it. the item is completely useless now... i expected better quality for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: B. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Weak hardware leads to product failure
customer_reviews.text: Cast metal hardware stripped the threads within 5 uses stretching one shoe as directed in packaging (insert, press forward, turn till play is removed and stretcher is snug, add additional turn to stretch.) The stripped threads on the adjustment screw have rendered the product unusable, as it can no longer be tightened. Additionally, the holes for the pressure point inserts are not evenly located on the two halves of the stretcher, making it impossible to uniformly stretch right and left shoes, and are too loose to reliably retain the inserts. This product is a complete failure and not worth consideration
customer_reviews.author: Firemoth

customer_reviews.title: A quality product that works!
customer_reviews.text: I started out with 3 pairs of my hiking boots which all 3 pairs are suppose to be 12 wide. They are Salomon, Hi-tec and Keene. The toe box in all 3 are just too tight for me. The Foot Fitter fixed all 3 pair! If your boots aren't long enough it isn't gonna to help you there. My girlfriend is a nurse and on her feet most of the day. She has a bunion by her big toe and used the attachment for that and it worked. She wears a size 9 but it still worked in her Nikes! Don't suffer with squished toes this thing works. Just follow directions and 8 hours per shoe and it's done.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work even once - Arrived with “gear” stripped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because it seemed like the best quality boot stretcher available. I don’t mind paying more if an item will last longer and function better. The gear on this was broken, no matter how much I turned the knob it would not open, not even a little bit. This seems to be a recent, but common, issue. I do wonder if the problem is with the manufacture, or if Amazon keeps sending out broken returns which is skewing the reviews. Either way, although I still need a boot stretcher, I won’t be buying this brand in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Suppose to fit sizes 11-13, it seems a little tight for size 11 but it worked in my boots anyway. I will say this, a size 11 by one company will not necessarily be the same size as another company's 11 (So maybe my size 11 is a little small). You would think there would be a universal size for shoe sizes that all companies have to go by but that's not the case. Anyway this is a well made product, the handle & the screws internally are metal, not plastic like some and you are supplied with 3 bunion/corn plugs (these are metal as well) for relief. All in all I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Desperado

customer_reviews.title: FootFitter Premium Professional Boot Width Stretcher (Large)
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet so even after buying shoes marked 2E/4E/EW etc, they sometimes hurt. The problem isn't when I first try them on because I wouldn't buy them if they felt narrow, it's the fact that I have a couple pair that hurt after wearing them awhile (it's always my left foot too). Anyway I used this stretcher on my troublesome left boots and it definitely did enough to make them comfortable and I can now wear them all day without issue. I have a 10.5-11 size foot and I bought the large size. Although it worked fine, it is a tight squeeze so I'd suggest ordering true to size. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Looper34

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty Shoe Stretching Only
customer_reviews.text: Constructed with inferior metal. As you can see in the picture, the threads on the rod fail. I did successfully stretch a new pair of boots and an old pair of dress shoes which were too narrow. When I tried to stretch a new pair of moccasins, the threads on the rod failed; the threads just broke off and the mechanism could not catch and widen the wooden form. This Footfitter product might be acceptable for very light work, but for genuine, everyday shoe stretching, you might want to consider a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Cato

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Stretching Boots
customer_reviews.text: My foot is quite wide, and it is hard to find high quality hiking boots wide enough to fit comfortably. This shoe stretcher has saved the day. Included are several inserts that can be added to the basic stretcher to increase stretching at specific locations. After reading several comments about stripping threads, I added a slight amount of high quality automotive grease - not TOO much - to the threads and have had no problem. I highly recommend this as an effective tool of good quality. I have used it extensively to get these new boots stretched properly, and the tool has held up well and done its job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TomBob

customer_reviews.title: Wide feet can now fit in regular shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid, boot widener. I used it on my regular width/slightly wider shoes to make them even wider so I can actually wear them without toe pain. One thing I did notice however, was that when stretching regularly, without the metal nubs installed, I didn't get much width out of the stretch I would max out the width it could go to, but that didn't seen to be wide enough for what I needed. Was thinking of returning it, but I decided to try it out with the metal nubs for bunions and corns. Once I put the metal nubs in it actually made a big difference, and stretched the shoes very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

customer_reviews.title: Rescued Sperry boots
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Sperry waterproof boots (womens size 8) that were just a little too tight to wear. One session with with this stretcher and now they fit perfectly. No damage to the boots in stretching and an easy process. Beware - these are offered as single stretchers - I bought two so that I had one configured for each foot (set up as the obvious left and right). It worked so well, moved on to a pair of expensive walking shoes. Same outcome. I can now buy shoes (or boots) and know that if there is a slight fit issue (I need a wider shoe than most) - I can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: stripped threads
customer_reviews.text: The stretcher worked well enough until the threads on the screw stripped and it no longer works. I called the seller and they don't have replacement parts and said I would have to buy a new one. I have ordered a new stretcher but its one of the other brands (Houndsbay bulldog). One other annoyance is that it came with only 3 of the bunion/corn plugs. The 6 plugs provided with the Houndsbay unit it better because both sides of the boot can be stretched simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Karkn

customer_reviews.title: Not assembled, missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Terribly disappointed after the glowing reviews. This isn't assembled at the joint & didn't come with any parts to assemble. It appeared the item may have been opened & returned as the packing material wasn't wrapped around the item, just stuffed in beside the stretcher. I'd like to upgrade the review but need positive action to remedy this. Severely dissatisfied at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After the second use the universal joint pins fell out and were impossible to fix. I emailed FootFitter for help with putting the pins back in and they said since I bought it here on Amazon they weren't responsible for breakage. Unfortunately Amazon's warranty ran out for a return. Basically FootFitter told me I was s**t out of luck. After spending $45 for ONE shoe stretcher you would think it would work more than once without falling apart! What a total waste of money. Don't buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Boot stretcher works.
customer_reviews.text: Well built and looks like it will last. I placed a bit of white grease on the universal joint and the threaded shaft that made the device much smoother to operate. Although the directions say otherwise, it looks like it will work on regular men's shoes and women's flats. Not certain about high boots as the device just fit my low-rise walking boot. If the extension rod forms a right angle, it may be too acute for the universal joint to function. Then something may break. Oh, and remember, this is ONLY for the toe box (front) of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: nivrams

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wish it were wider.
customer_reviews.text: I finally found something to work!! My feet are incredibly wide and this stretcher is only wide enough with the added metal bumps but it does work. I wish it were wider. I wear a womens size 9 or 10 and I was hoping this would get wide enough that I could use it on my dads cowboy boots also but it really isn't. He wears an 11. Maybe I could wedge something in beside the wood and make it bigger? At least the mechanism works though. I had a set of plastic stretchers that were junk and I returned them for this.
customer_reviews.author: MamaSews

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet for this old man
customer_reviews.text: Getting old sucks! Now that gout and bunions are part of my feet breaking in new boots is usually painful and takes weeks and weeks. I wear a 13 Narrow leather boot and tennis shoes. This do-dad fits perfect, a drop of oil on the threads, turn turn turn and in a few days both boots fit around all the bumps and tender spots and all broke in within 5 days... and I didn’t have to wear 2 pairs of socks, wet the boot, or suffer any blisters. I had a hot spots the first couple days and used this do-dad over night and Wa-La Happy Feet.
customer_reviews.author: nerd

customer_reviews.title: This is A very nice boot stretcher !
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this boot stretcher . I bought it to stretch my new slip on work boots . The best advice that I can give for this thing is to lubricate the threads with A drop or two of light oil or wd40 . After that it worked very smooth and easy , stretched out the boots over night . After A couple of nights and A little playing around with it, my new boots fit very well from starting out rather tight. Tried them out on A pair of ropers and same results . Nice product,much thanks
customer_reviews.author: jak

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great! I bought them for my husband. His boots were a little tight when he bought them 30 years ago but now they are almost impossible to get off. He only wears them a couple of times a year. After using the stretcher for 24 hours in each boot, they fit better than when he bought them originally. I remember shoe stretchers from 40 years ago and am glad I found them on Amazon. I am going to reclaim a pair of my own boots.
customer_reviews.author: flugelgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great for tight fitting leather boots!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I had some Red Wing Iron rangers that were just a tad too tight and hurting my pinky toe. The boot stretcher worked great to stretch them out to the perfect fit. I stretched them just a little at a time wetting the leather and stretching it just slightly for one night and then wearing them the next day. I did this three times until I had the perfect fit. I probably could have stretched them completely in one night, but I didn't want to stress the leather and stitching too far.
customer_reviews.author: dsfisherman89

customer_reviews.title: A quality product that works very well-- So far!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it on one pair of boots but it worked flawlessly! Very well made. I believe this product is made for larger boots, ie >men's 5 or 6. This company probably offers a smaller version. If you take your time and use as directed, they will stretch. You may have to do this a few times, moving the nubs around to address problem areas. Obviously, this is "German" engineered. A quality product that works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Keefire

customer_reviews.title: Mine was either defective or this is junk
customer_reviews.text: I needed this product to stretch a pair of motorcycle boots. However, this product is JUNK! The jaws start opening but when still not wide enough to contact the boot you hear a pop and the jaws close again. I demonstrated this outside the boot. This product is poorly designed because the nut assembly the screw goes into ultimately slips. Unfortunately, I am beyond the Amazon return period Don't purchase this. Update 6/15/2018 I contacted Footfitter and was shipped a replacement boot stretcher. The replacement works as it should and I am happy with it. I upgraded my review from 1 star to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Roger B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need to do the job
customer_reviews.text: Opened package and put directly into a boot that had an uncomfortable tight spot near the toe area. I used leather oil to soften the front of the boot and positioned the stretcher to target that area. I left the stretcher in the boot overnight and have been wearing the boot since, problem solved. This stretcher is well built, works perfectly and I feel is worth the price. Sometimes you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Francine U.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Item broke upon first use. Actually broke as I was removing it from my boot. Several small metal pins came out and scattered on the floor. Returning for a refund. Very disappointed and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Threads strip with limited use.
customer_reviews.text: I actually really liked this product until it didn't work anymore. I have a bunion on one foot so needed to stretch just one shoe in one spot. Thats where the little black attachments came in so handy. Didn't have to expand very much as I have a narrow feet. Worked beautifully. I have had this product for 2 years and probably have used it a dozen times. Won't work anymore as it appears threads are stripped. So disappointed because I really need this product! It would have given 5 stars for when it worked. Zero for breaking so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary73

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for people w/2 different shoe sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have one foot larger than the other so I either have to buy shoes/boots w/one either too large or too small and then end up trying to make them work & miserable-but not anymore. This works like a charm to stretch the smaller one so I can wear some of my nice shoes I never wear since I don’t want to limp around after an hour in them since I’m on my feet all day. Wish I had this about 20 years ago. I would also recommend a shoe stretch spray & a little WD40 since mine was a little hard to use initially-until I used the WD40.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, very very easy to use. I used it on my timberland boots to make more room in the toe box. I unfortunately have a mild bunion on my right foot (big toe joint). While it doesnt make my foot look ugly (I still have cute feet whew!), I do sometimes buy my shoes a half size bigger. With this product, I used the included peg shapes to get an even better focus on the area I needed to stretch in the boot. I didn't use any sprays beforehand to treat the shoe. I followed the recommendation of stretching the boot little by little over the course of a few days. My boots are much more comfortable now!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Stretches out the boot. Just like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Got bunions or some other funky ass foot problem AND have an ornery leather boot? Well this little rascal is just what you need. Regular shoe stretchers can't get into a boot so the right angle twister thinger does the trick. Slather some isopropyl on there (don't waste your money on that "official moot stretcher liquid " crap, it's just regular old isopropyl alcohol!) and stretch away.
customer_reviews.author: Brady B

customer_reviews.title: Does the job pretty well
customer_reviews.text: This does a pretty good job of stretching my boots. It took several days but the boots now fit my foot a lot better. The materials are good, it works as it should and seem well built. I am basically happy with it. It is a bit pricey and I think maybe they should give you two for that price instead of one. Other than that, it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone99

customer_reviews.title: Fine product.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't supposed to "fit", so I'm not sure why I had to respond to that question before I could review. Nonetheless, this is a perfectly good product. Well made, from apparently high quality components. Works as described. I bought this to use on skates, but now that I have it, I'm sure I have a number of other shoes/boots on which I can use this to improve their fit. I just may buy a second one so I can do both shoes at once.
customer_reviews.author: wolfie

customer_reviews.title: but I found that using a stretching spray works way better. I made my own after looking on-line by ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of engineer boots that were the correct size, but still needed a little adjustment to fit my feet correctly after breaking them in. This did the job. At first I just tried using it on one of the boots after wearing them all day, but I found that using a stretching spray works way better. I made my own after looking on-line by mixing half parts denatured alcohol and water. The inserts included are nice but I conformed my boots using a bit of masking tape and cardboard to the FootFitter in the spots that I needed where the included inserts didn’t fit
customer_reviews.author: Michael Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3rd use but was replaced by seller ASAP.
customer_reviews.text: The threads on the boot stretcher stripped and the handle broke off the 3rd time I used it. I hv requested a refund or an exchange from the seller. No response yet, so we’ll see. I’m giving it 2 stars for the malfunction but could have just been a defective part. Let’s see how the seller stands behind their product. Update on broken item. The seller has replaced the item. The seller displayed excellent customer service and prompt attention to problem
customer_reviews.author: Tim wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Metal Fatigue Failure
customer_reviews.text: weak swivel hinge between long handle and boot stretcher prong. This weakness resulted in metal fatigue and stretch at the weak point. The key then fell out. I have used this product 3 times in 4 months before product failure. Apparently return or replacement is now not an option. I do not recommend this specific product, however, I would definitely buy a second FootFitter Premium Professional One-Way Shoe Stretcher, Width Only.
customer_reviews.author: benweaver00@outlook.com

customer_reviews.title: A hoot of a boot stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I attached a metal spot enlarger on the wooden plank approximately where my right foot bunion is and slid the wooden banana into my boot. The fit for the large FootFitter on my size 11 was perfect. Twisting the mechanism to make the enlargement was a snap. I kept the stretcher on the boot for a few days, with a small turn each day to increase the stretching. The boot fits very well on my right foot now. Glad I made the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Updated
customer_reviews.text: This boot stretcher broke on a ordinary pair of Chelsea boots - I am very disappointed with the quality. I turned it until it was moderately tight and the connector that attaches the arm broke right off. **Update ** - I have attempted to contact the company more than five times and have yet to receive a response via email or telephone. **Update Apr 24 - Company has rectified the situation and sent a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I did not have to worry about this breaking. I used it with confidence, and was able to tighten it up aggressively, with no problems. There may be other, similar products available, but you are unlikely to break this one. Reviews from the others suggest that is common with the less expensive copies of this fine piece of craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: untergeek

customer_reviews.title: What a good piece of equipment extremely well made
customer_reviews.text: What a good piece of equipment extremely well made , and real fast delivery time . I've been suffering with duty boots that just didn't fit and took forever to break in . I wish i would have known about this years ago . Wouldn't have the foot problem i have. Can't say enough . Have used it on two pairs of duty boots.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: What I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I finally ordered one of these. I've had trouble with my right foot for years, my little toe gets sore rubbing inside the shoe. This gives me the room I need to stop that. I've never had problems with my left foot. Don't understand. But this works great to relieve my pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: You can only stretch one boot at a time.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the fine print. For $40 you only get one stretcher. Ridiculous for that amount of money. I have 2 feet. Not one. Also, you can't expand the toe unless the rod is horizontal so don't plan on having your boot zipped up as you attempt to stretch the toe!
customer_reviews.author: CCCC1216

customer_reviews.title: this product stopped expanding and is now useless.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for my boots and also used it on several pair of shoes. I was streching from side to side. This will not work for length. I used it on both leather and vinyl. Also combined it with a strech spray which work really well. UPDATE: Shortly after the window of return closed, this product stopped expanding and is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Quality product built well.
customer_reviews.text: This ia a purchase that I did my homework on and it paid off. Footfitter makes a quality product. This fit perfectly into my size 11 cowboy boots and the handle tighten down very smoothly. The tool has some heft to it and the crank was smooth even at the angle from the boot uppers. I would not hesitate to buy this again as I feel I got a great deal for how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: ITO

customer_reviews.title: great for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: This boot stretcher is what I have been wanting for years. I have a very wide foot and thus have a hard time finding wide shoes. With this stretcher, I can wear size d width and then stretch the toe box area just enough to make them comfortable. I can also add a little room in the toe box on my EE boots/shoes For the longest time, my feet got cold because they were compressed within the shoe. Wearing thicker socks meant more discomfort and colder feet - often preventing me from being outside for long. NOW, with this boot stretcher, I can comfortable wear all my leather boots/shoes
customer_reviews.author: GTSF

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, perfect for small tweaks on quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy, works on a few pairs of boots (1" heel or less) that I had that were a little too tight. Love the metal inserts to pinpoint trouble spots. It's a little hard to get it placed perfectly for a wide toe box/ pinkie toe, but if you're patient and gentle, it'll save you a lot of hassle, looking for shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Lyssandra

customer_reviews.title: It’s well made but has quirks
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it’s a good product, but it’s just not working for me. I guess the inside of my boots are too silky for this to work though, because every time I tighten it to stretch them, the whole stretcher slides back and is in the wrong spot and no matter what I do I can’t keep it forward. So I am giving up and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but only good for dress shoes and boots.
customer_reviews.text: This is best for dress shoes. My husband wanted it for his high-top sneakers and the front is too narrow to impact the tie box. He can only stretch to the large toe joint but his issue is his toes need more room. It would be nice if there were some inserts to expand the use for sneakers (tennis shoes for ppl not in the North East). It is well made. The wood is good and hard and the mechanism seems sturdy. 4 stars for craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Valerius Poplicola

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 days. Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on day 3. Won't turn without significant input and even then. It's cheap and not nearly worth the money. Find this exact same thing on eBay for half the money. Amazon has been flooded with crap. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's pricey compared to the other expanders BUT it is perfect for my boots. It works! I keep it expanded in my right boot which tend to pinch my little toes and now I'm wearing my pointed toes boots with no problem. Same thing with my steel toe Bates work boots. I also use the bunion and corn inserts to add as much room as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Nosey Parker

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: I have one foot that seems to need a little extra room. This boot Stretcher works great. Built quality is good. Had to drill a couple of extra holes the reach my particular problem areas, so not a big deal. Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Franck

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely magical! Everyone with bunions needs this!!!
customer_reviews.text: The FootFitter is amazing! I have developed a bunion on my foot so wearing my boots was very uncomfortable. I have 20 plus pair of boots, so just getting a bigger size was not an option. I stretched every pair! Absolutely saved me a small fortune! Thank you for a great product! Definitely one of the best items I’ve bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Halbert

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy device has saved me lots of money and time. I have wide feet and fashion boots that are the proper length are often too narrow on the ball of my foot. I have been able to stretch several pairs of Poshmark purchases that would otherwise have been a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Reard

customer_reviews.title: Impressed, Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a shoe/boot stretcher. Opted for this one, over some cheaper models, as those had very mixed reviews. I ordered a pair of Haix patrol boots, approx 6" tall, that I liked, but that were WAY too narrow in the toe box for me. I used a leather stretcher liquid spray and this stretcher over the course of approximately 5 days. Used the added pieces to stretch the boots in the rights areas, and this baby worked like a charm. Used the stretcher two times for each boot, and left it in 24hrs at a time, if that helps anyone. The boots are also a mix of leather and synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Mail Debaser

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful tool
customer_reviews.text: This small device was a life-saver. I am 23 years old and in the last couple of years, my left food must have grown a bit in the width, leaving many of my shoes that are still good too tight on the left side. The right side shoe would be fine but the left would give me a lot of pain and discomfort after a day of wear. I have used this to stretch a pair of Viberg boots, a pair of Timberlands, and two pairs of Adidas sneakers. It has worked perfectly. Just be patient with the stretching and do it multiple times if you need to. I have recommended this to many of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I kind of feel ripped off
customer_reviews.text: Well I just tried using it for the first time and it doesn't work. The handle won't turn.
customer_reviews.author: MarkPB

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it cliams to do! It's great.
customer_reviews.text: Helped me break in a pair of Doc Martens faster than I would have been able to, and with less discomfort, and broke in another pair of leather boots that I could barely wear in the first place. I have bunions so this is an absolute godsend. My feet are much more comfortable now.
customer_reviews.author: E.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you have wide feet and want to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product if you have wide feet and want to wear those shoes you buy but never end up wearing because they're uncomfortable. It takes several days to stretch your shoes properly so be patient. Also, put equal amounts of rubbing alcohol and water in a spray bottle and spray the outside of the shoe where it's going to be stretched (a recommendation from a cobbler on YouTube)
customer_reviews.author: Daisy M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it on a couple of boots I have and it has definitely stretched them maybe a 1/4 size or so in width and height. It is very easy to use. Note that it does tend to push back as you expand it (which is expected given the geometry of boots and the expander). I have solved this by putting small wood blocks behind the expander up against the back of the boot so that it cannot push back - and that has worked perfectly. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I used the foot fitter once and it wouldn't open and close after the first use. I contacted Amazon and they are going to refund me after they receive the item back. This is a lot of trouble for me but for the cost I will have to do it. I am disappointed after reading other reviews. I had high expectations for this boot and shoe stretcher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: This boot stretcher is made of quality materials. I ordered it to stretch out a pair of cowboy boots that I had bought that were too narrow. After several days (with small adjustments a couple of times a day) the boots now fit perfectly. This stretcher is definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: boxjump

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first but threading failed after a week
customer_reviews.text: Used this to stretch out a pair of new leather boots. Worked great for one boot, but when I got to the other, the threading stripped and I wasn't able to stretch it as much. Quality/worksmanship is poor on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Huynh

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: It looked lovely but arrived completely non-functioning. The threads between the rod and cross bar would not engage. With even the tiniest pressure resisting the spread of the wooden forms, it would slip. Did not do it’s most basic job. I have initiated a return.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Clarke

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy product that I assume would work for most people
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy product that I assume would work for most people. It has not worked for me but I think it is because of my boots not the spreader. I’ve tried for 2 months to widen my Bates boot but it doesn’t seem to provide relief. I give it 5 stars because this feels like quality work and I really think my boots are the issue.
customer_reviews.author: The guy who bought this

customer_reviews.title: Works great not only with boots
customer_reviews.text: This works for not only boots, ankle boots are tall ones. I tried in regular shoes too and I have been so happy and painless with any kind of shoe. You can locate those black plugs to recreate pressure points and will guarantee they will be better after.
customer_reviews.author: RSR 78

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shoe/boot stretcher on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best stretcher's on the market for all materials. Once you put the stretcher in your shoes, you can adjust the width by turning the handle at the end. Highly recommend this product!!!!!1
customer_reviews.author: FOTOGUY

customer_reviews.title: Industrial strength- does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought cheaper ones for my work and motorcycle boots and the plastic cracked- these are pricey but industrial strength- I don’t put them in and wait 8 hours as suggested- I put them in, tighten, next day tighten more etc and Get significant stretching
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It was expensive, and mine broke after a few months. There are better options on Amazon. I contacted the company and they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This stretcher works very well. I'm giving five stars even though there are two things I wish they would improve: 1)add a heel brace that would keep the thing from sliding away from the toe box as you tighten it 2)throw in a couple more of the black plastic pressure points, and make a larger one as well
customer_reviews.author: Professor Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first it looked as it would work. But, using them in a pair of Danner Acadia's i could not get the front of the stretcher to stay in the toe box. It would keep sliding back and lose tension. Then, the tensioning screw seems to have cross thread and now I have nothing. Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned other boot stretchers similar to this one but this one works much better and is of much higher quality. After tow hours, they loosened up my English Beatle Chelsea boots so they're very comfortable now.
customer_reviews.author: John Kallas

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: This did precisely what I needed on a pair of my hiking boots. I needed a little extra room in the toe box of my right boot and this did the job with ease. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dfwjr

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the cheap ones, get this brand, it's real well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal, don't waste money on the cheaper ones on Amazon or E-bay. I order the cheapest one available on E-bay ($29) and it has a plastic spreader one, broke the first time I used it, following the instructions! It was not anywhere near as well made or packaged as this one from Foot Fitter. I had to send it back, took a month to get a refund. This one is well worth the extra $20 or so.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I bought another that is working great! It stretched my boots perfectly- especially where needed
customer_reviews.text: it broke after the first use. I was promptly refunded. I bought another that is working great! It stretched my boots perfectly- especially where needed.
customer_reviews.author: mary connor

customer_reviews.title: Part stripped out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product over a year ago and used it once. I moved and I got the stretcher out and went to use it again and the threaded pin that makes the stretcher spread stripped out in the middle. Not a problem, I called the company and I was told they do not sell parts and I have had this over 90 days. This is not rocket science and the part that makes this work is not replaceable, up to you but I will not purchase from them again or recommend them. They could easily sell the replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product well built
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Steel screw and nut. Die cast wedge parts. No plastic. Nicely finished wood, although I used duct tape and cardboard to fine tune. The loose pad attachments are pretty high/thick and seemed to stretch more in one spot than I wanted. . Can easily drill more holes to locate them wherever you want on the wood. I used to widen toe cap area, then tape and cardboard to widen a specific spot. Used on two pairs of hiking/work leather 6 inch high boots. I don't need the long handle, but overall made a couple sets of shoes usable so well paid for itself already.
customer_reviews.author: Kevincj46

customer_reviews.title: stretched one western boot which nicely added extra room for my Wife’s left foot
customer_reviews.text: Recent purchase, stretched one western boot which nicely added extra room for my Wife’s left foot. She is please pd with the results. This product was extremely simple to use and a seemingly well made product. Very pleased with the purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Annapolis Haven

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: I used this product as soon as it arrived. I left in tightened, in one boot at a time, for about 8 hours, re-tightening a couple of times, and the pair of cowboy boots fit perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: SkywagonJim

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, it’s great for widening shoes. I wish, especially at this cost, that it included two so that you could do both left and right shoe at the same time. The quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bales

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I like this product however the pieces that plug into the sides fit very loosely in fall out that’s the only complaint I had with this product other than that it worked great
customer_reviews.author: GLOCKIOMM

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing
customer_reviews.text: The product looks and works as described but you will not receive the spot stretching plugs as they were not included, you will have to order them through Footfitter at additional cost....
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I paid $45 for my boot stretcher. It has worked very well when used along with liquid shoe stretcher. I've used it for both boots and booties and it has worked perfectly. I have heard that the cheaper ones break very easily so while it may seem like a lot of money, it really isn't worth going cheap.
customer_reviews.author: K. Y. Krawczyk

customer_reviews.title: ahhh it just ok
customer_reviews.text: it is kind of difficult to work with . the screw devise is very stiff so you dont know if it is getting tight or the tool is tight . i have plastic strechers that work better at 17.00 instead of 39.00 dollars
customer_reviews.author: bob alderman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: This boot stretch worked perfectly. I used on my slip on boots. I used the round stretch plug to stretch my boot for my swollen ball joint caused by gout. It worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: ShopTinker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect (non-cowboy) boot stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I have a second one of these and use them now as shoe trees for my lace up boots, actually, period brogans. There is a stretcher specifically for cowboy boots and this isn't it. This works great (and better) on lace ups. I had to stretch both of my boots and this did the job. Of course it will work equally well on shoes, so it is a worthwhile thing (or pair of things) to have.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Fits my boots size 8
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems pretty universal. I used it for my new boots size 8 and I also used it for my husbands shoes size 10. Works great. It doesn't look bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Broke after just 5-6 uses, threads on the metal screw got stripped and the stretcher now is useless. Original review: excellent product, no issues with quality. can stretch a boot overnight, so one stretcher is enough if you are patients and can wait a day to stretch both boots
customer_reviews.author: Europe

customer_reviews.title: All Metal Parts Make the Difference
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another brand and they broke the first time used due to cheap plastic mechanism parts that stripped out easily. This product has an all metal mechanism. It works perfectly and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Coupel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Fixed all my problems with tight fitting toes in my hunting boots and saved me continual frustration with buying $300-400 boots that felt good in the store, but blistered my toes on the trail. I have a very wide EE foot. Almost impossible to fit in premium hiking/hunting boots, especially european brands (e.g., Lowa, Zamberlan). Product stretched the boots toe box out enough to fit my foot correctly. Very well built and hinged adjusting mechanisim works great to access even tall 9" boots. Save your money on shoe strecher liquids or sprays. Make your own in a small spray bottle for for .20 cents...all it is is 50% water 50% rubbing alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: William Smith

customer_reviews.title: Repair
customer_reviews.text: I had to have go to the machine shop and changed to 8 grade steel metal is too soft and it eats itself up on the threads. Now works great nothing stops it thick army boots nothing cost to modify guts $300.00. That's for 2
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Stretched to fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, boots always pinched and hurt my feet, after buying some shoe stretcher liquid and this Footfitter stretching the boot for 8 hours each boot. They fit great, had them on for hours and not a bit of pain. Worked for both pairs of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Justice

customer_reviews.title: Streched my new shoes beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. After purchasing this shoe stretcher my wide feet can now comfortably fit in the new pair of narrow high top sneakers; that hurt to wear before.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, worse customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. I bought one to help stretch some new leather boots. It worked great at first but after 3 months the threads galled up so badly I could barely turn the handle to expand it. Shortly after this the threads stripped out and the whole thing is useless. I reached out to Footfitter several times by both email and calling them over the phone but never received any response.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to stretch both my regular shoes and boots in the forefoot area. This is a quality product, made of wood and strong working parts plus it's easy to use. Glad I paid the extra money for a wooden product!
customer_reviews.author: Carol M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 uses..
customer_reviews.text: The bolt that expands the stretcher stripped after two uses and the handle just broke off.... Waiting on a replacement, so for now 1 star. Will update when replacement gets here. But I'm not sure if the replacement will be any better..
customer_reviews.author: JBrooks

customer_reviews.title: A must for stretching boots.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have ordered. This one is for my wife. Very good quality. They make it easy to stretch a shoe or boot to fit. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ta

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It really shapes the boot for my foot. Used the shoe style but it always had trouble getting all the way in. Glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: son of the hounds

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use...really well made!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made product. It shipped fast & is very easy to use. I purchase one for myself in my size & one for my husband's shoe size...very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Clunky mechanism that quickly broke stretching my boots. No reply from the company on it's 2 year warranty yet. Looks like I'm out the $40 +.
customer_reviews.author: vonBeavis

customer_reviews.title: This boot stretcher is an incredible product!
customer_reviews.text: This boot stretcher is incredible! I have several pairs of designer boots I bought and needed to stretch due to the tight leather. This boot stretcher did the job after about 6 times with a solution of half rubbing alcohol and water sprayed inside before stretching. Wonderful quality. As I got older my feet got a little bigger :) this is such an amazing product. Don't waste your money on anot her one this one works!
customer_reviews.author: CLT

customer_reviews.title: A quality product.
customer_reviews.text: The Footfitter boot stretcher is a quality product. I've been using it on a daily basis for about a month or two. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have had trouble with my feet for a long time and my orthopedic doctor suggested that I try to stretch the toe boot of my shoes. This device did the job and I was so impressed with it I have already suggested it to other people I know. What an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait till I'm so old to get one of these?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the SH*T! amazing! works even better if you get the little spray bottle of boot strecher to spray on the boots first...love it love it!
customer_reviews.author: J B Himer

product_meta.title: FootFitter Premium Professional Boot Width Stretcher for Stretching Hiking/Work Boots
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Package Dimensions :22.8 x 4.4 x 3.8 inches; 1.95 Pounds
 * Item model number :101-002-12
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :April 22, 2007
 * ASIN :B000PMPTF4

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #44,550 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #50 inShoe & Boot Trees 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.1 out of 5 stars1,403 ratings
feature_bullets: BOOT STRETCHER: Designed with extra long shaft to easily stretch boots!
BEECH WOOD: Polished German harvested Beech Wood boot stretcher!
SPOT RELIEF: Includes 3 Bunion/Corn plugs for pressure point relief!
SINGLE STRETCHER: Single stretcher only! Can be used for right & left boots!
